verses.text: Now will I \w sing|strong="H7891"\w* to my \w wellbeloved|strong="H3039"\w* a \w song|strong="H7892"\w* of my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* touching his \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*. My \w wellbeloved|strong="H3039"\w* hath a \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* in a very \w fruitful|strong="H1121"\w* \w hill|strong="H7161"\w*:\f + \fr 5.1 \ft a very…: Heb. the horn of the son of oil\f*

And he \w fenced|strong="H5823"\w* it, and gathered out the \w stones|strong="H5619"\w* thereof, and \w planted|strong="H5193"\w* it with the choicest \w vine|strong="H8321"\w*, and \w built|strong="H1129"\w* a \w tower|strong="H4026"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of it, and also \w made|strong="H2672"\w* a \w winepress|strong="H3342"\w* therein: and he \w looked|strong="H6960"\w* that it should bring \w forth|strong="H6213"\w* \w grapes|strong="H6025"\w*, and it brought \w forth|strong="H6213"\w* wild \w grapes|strong="H0891"\w*.\f + \fr 5.2 \ft fenced: or, made a wall about\f*\f + \fr 5.2 \ft made: Heb. hewed\f*

And now, O \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \w judge|strong="H8199"\w*, I pray you, betwixt me and my \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*.

What could have been \w done|strong="H6213"\w* more to my \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*, that I have not \w done|strong="H6213"\w* in it? \w wherefore|strong="H4069"\w*, when I \w looked|strong="H6960"\w* that it should bring \w forth|strong="H6213"\w* \w grapes|strong="H6025"\w*, brought it \w forth|strong="H6213"\w* wild \w grapes|strong="H0891"\w*?

And now go to; I will \w tell|strong="H3045"\w* you what I will \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to my \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*: I will take \w away|strong="H5493"\w* the \w hedge|strong="H4881"\w* thereof, and it shall be eaten \w up|strong="H1197"\w*; \add and\add* break \w down|strong="H6555"\w* the \w wall|strong="H1447"\w* thereof, and it shall be trodden \w down|strong="H4823"\w*:\f + \fr 5.5 \ft trodden…: Heb. for a treading\f*

And I will \w lay|strong="H7896"\w* it \w waste|strong="H1326"\w*: it shall not be \w pruned|strong="H2168"\w*, nor \w digged|strong="H5737"\w*; but there shall come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* \w briers|strong="H8068"\w* and \w thorns|strong="H7898"\w*: I will also \w command|strong="H6680"\w* the \w clouds|strong="H5645"\w* that they \w rain|strong="H4305"\w* no \w rain|strong="H4306"\w* upon it.

For the \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* \add is\add* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* his \w pleasant|strong="H8191"\w* \w plant|strong="H5194"\w*: and he \w looked|strong="H6960"\w* for \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, but behold \w oppression|strong="H4939"\w*; for \w righteousness|strong="H6666"\w*, but behold a \w cry|strong="H6818"\w*.\f + \fr 5.7 \ft his…: Heb. plant of his pleasures\f*\f + \fr 5.7 \ft oppression: Heb. a scab\f*

¶ \w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto them that \w join|strong="H5060"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* to \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, \add that\add* \w lay|strong="H7126"\w* \w field|strong="H7704"\w* to \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, till \add there be\add* \w no|strong="H0657"\w* \w place|strong="H4725"\w*, that they may be \w placed|strong="H3427"\w* alone in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*!\f + \fr 5.8 \ft they: Heb. ye\f*

In mine \w ears|strong="H0241"\w* \add said\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*, Of a \w truth|strong="H3808"\w* \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w houses|strong="H1004"\w* shall be \w desolate|strong="H8047"\w*, \add even\add* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* and \w fair|strong="H2896"\w*, without \w inhabitant|strong="H3427"\w*.\f + \fr 5.9 \ft In…: or, This is in mine ears, saith the \+nd LORD\+nd*, etc\f*\f + \fr 5.9 \ft Of a…: Heb. If not, etc\f*

\w Yea|strong="H3588"\w*, \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w acres|strong="H6776"\w* of \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* shall \w yield|strong="H6213"\w* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w bath|strong="H1324"\w*, and the \w seed|strong="H2233"\w* of an \w homer|strong="H2563"\w* shall \w yield|strong="H6213"\w* an \w ephah|strong="H0374"\w*.

¶ \w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto them that rise up \w early|strong="H7925"\w* in the \w morning|strong="H1242"\w*, \add that\add* they may \w follow|strong="H7291"\w* strong \w drink|strong="H7941"\w*; that \w continue|strong="H0309"\w* until \w night|strong="H5399"\w*, \add till\add* \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* \w inflame|strong="H1814"\w* them!\f + \fr 5.11 \ft inflame: of, pursue\f*

And the \w harp|strong="H3658"\w*, and the \w viol|strong="H5035"\w*, the \w tabret|strong="H8596"\w*, and \w pipe|strong="H2485"\w*, and \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, are in their \w feasts|strong="H4960"\w*: but they \w regard|strong="H5027"\w* not the \w work|strong="H6467"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, neither \w consider|strong="H7200"\w* the \w operation|strong="H4639"\w* of his \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*.

¶ Therefore my \w people|strong="H5971"\w* are gone into \w captivity|strong="H1540"\w*, because \add they have\add* no \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*: and their \w honourable|strong="H3519"\w* \w men|strong="H4962"\w* \add are\add* \w famished|strong="H7458"\w*, and their \w multitude|strong="H1995"\w* dried \w up|strong="H6704"\w* with \w thirst|strong="H6772"\w*.\f + \fr 5.13 \ft honourable…: Heb. glory are men of famine\f*

Therefore \w hell|strong="H7585"\w* hath \w enlarged|strong="H7337"\w* \w herself|strong="H5315"\w*, and \w opened|strong="H6473"\w* her \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* without \w measure|strong="H2706"\w*: and their \w glory|strong="H1926"\w*, and their \w multitude|strong="H1995"\w*, and their \w pomp|strong="H7588"\w*, and he that \w rejoiceth|strong="H5938"\w*, shall \w descend|strong="H3381"\w* into it.

And the mean \w man|strong="H0120"\w* shall be brought \w down|strong="H7817"\w*, and the mighty \w man|strong="H0376"\w* shall be \w humbled|strong="H8213"\w*, and the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of the \w lofty|strong="H1364"\w* shall be \w humbled|strong="H8213"\w*:

But the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* shall be \w exalted|strong="H1361"\w* in \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, and \w God|strong="H0410"\w* that is \w holy|strong="H6918"\w* shall be \w sanctified|strong="H6942"\w* in \w righteousness|strong="H6666"\w*.\f + \fr 5.16 \ft God…: or, the holy God: Heb. the God the holy\f*

Then shall the \w lambs|strong="H3532"\w* \w feed|strong="H7462"\w* after their \w manner|strong="H1699"\w*, and the waste \w places|strong="H2723"\w* of the fat \w ones|strong="H4220"\w* shall \w strangers|strong="H1481"\w* \w eat|strong="H0398"\w*.

\w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto them that \w draw|strong="H4900"\w* \w iniquity|strong="H5771"\w* with \w cords|strong="H2256"\w* of \w vanity|strong="H7723"\w*, and \w sin|strong="H2403"\w* as it were with a \w cart|strong="H5699"\w* \w rope|strong="H5688"\w*:

That \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, Let him make \w speed|strong="H4116"\w*, \add and\add* \w hasten|strong="H2363"\w* his \w work|strong="H4639"\w*, that we may \w see|strong="H7200"\w* \add it:\add* and let the \w counsel|strong="H6098"\w* of the Holy \w One|strong="H6918"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* draw \w nigh|strong="H7126"\w* and \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, that we may \w know|strong="H3045"\w* \add it\add*!

¶ \w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto them that \w call|strong="H0559"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, and \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*; that \w put|strong="H7760"\w* \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w* for \w light|strong="H0216"\w*, and \w light|strong="H0216"\w* for \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w*; that \w put|strong="H7760"\w* \w bitter|strong="H4751"\w* for \w sweet|strong="H4966"\w*, and \w sweet|strong="H4966"\w* for \w bitter|strong="H4751"\w*!\f + \fr 5.20 \ft call…: Heb. say concerning evil, It is good, etc\f*

\w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto \add them that are\add* \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* in their own \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, and \w prudent|strong="H0995"\w* in their own \w sight|strong="H6440"\w*!\f + \fr 5.21 \ft in their own sight: Heb. before their face\f*

\w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto \add them that are\add* \w mighty|strong="H1368"\w* to \w drink|strong="H8354"\w* \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, and \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w strength|strong="H2428"\w* to \w mingle|strong="H4537"\w* strong \w drink|strong="H7941"\w*:

Which \w justify|strong="H6663"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \w for|strong="H6118"\w* \w reward|strong="H7810"\w*, and take \w away|strong="H5493"\w* the \w righteousness|strong="H6666"\w* of the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* from him!

Therefore as the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* \w devoureth|strong="H0398"\w* the \w stubble|strong="H7179"\w*, and the \w flame|strong="H3956"\w* \w consumeth|strong="H7503"\w* the \w chaff|strong="H2842"\w*, \add so\add* their \w root|strong="H8328"\w* shall be as \w rottenness|strong="H4716"\w*, and their \w blossom|strong="H6525"\w* shall go \w up|strong="H5927"\w* as \w dust|strong="H0080"\w*: because they have cast \w away|strong="H3988"\w* the \w law|strong="H8451"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*, and \w despised|strong="H5006"\w* the \w word|strong="H0565"\w* of the Holy \w One|strong="H6918"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.\f + \fr 5.24 \ft fire: Heb. tongue of fire\f*

Therefore is the \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w kindled|strong="H2734"\w* against his \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and he hath stretched \w forth|strong="H5186"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* against them, and hath \w smitten|strong="H5221"\w* them: and the \w hills|strong="H2022"\w* did \w tremble|strong="H7264"\w*, and their \w carcases|strong="H5038"\w* \add were\add* \w torn|strong="H5478"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of the \w streets|strong="H2351"\w*. For all this his \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* is not turned \w away|strong="H7725"\w*, but his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* \add is\add* stretched \w out|strong="H5186"\w* still.\f + \fr 5.25 \ft torn: or, as dung\f*

¶ And he will lift \w up|strong="H5375"\w* an \w ensign|strong="H5251"\w* to the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* from \w far|strong="H7350"\w*, and will \w hiss|strong="H8319"\w* unto them from the \w end|strong="H7097"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*: and, behold, they shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* with \w speed|strong="H4120"\w* \w swiftly|strong="H7031"\w*:

None shall be \w weary|strong="H5889"\w* nor \w stumble|strong="H3782"\w* among them; none shall \w slumber|strong="H5123"\w* nor \w sleep|strong="H3462"\w*; neither shall the \w girdle|strong="H0232"\w* of their \w loins|strong="H2504"\w* be \w loosed|strong="H6605"\w*, nor the \w latchet|strong="H8288"\w* of their \w shoes|strong="H5275"\w* be \w broken|strong="H5423"\w*:

Whose \w arrows|strong="H2671"\w* \add are\add* \w sharp|strong="H8150"\w*, and all their \w bows|strong="H7198"\w* \w bent|strong="H1869"\w*, their \w horses’|strong="H5483"\w* \w hoofs|strong="H6541"\w* shall be \w counted|strong="H2803"\w* like \w flint|strong="H6862"\w*, and their \w wheels|strong="H1534"\w* like a \w whirlwind|strong="H5492"\w*:

Their \w roaring|strong="H7581"\w* \add shall be\add* like a \w lion|strong="H3833"\w*, they shall \w roar|strong="H7580"\w* like young \w lions|strong="H3715"\w*: yea, they shall \w roar|strong="H5098"\w*, and lay \w hold|strong="H0270"\w* of the \w prey|strong="H2964"\w*, and shall carry \add it\add* away \w safe|strong="H6403"\w*, and none shall \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* \add it\add*.

And in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* they shall \w roar|strong="H5098"\w* against them like the \w roaring|strong="H5100"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*: and if \add one\add* \w look|strong="H5027"\w* unto the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, behold \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w* \add and\add* \w sorrow|strong="H6862"\w*, and the \w light|strong="H0216"\w* is \w darkened|strong="H2821"\w* in the \w heavens|strong="H6183"\w* thereof.\f + \fr 5.30 \ft sorrow: or, distress\f*\f + \fr 5.30 \ft and the light…: or, when it is light, it shall be dark in the destructions thereof\f*
